page.title: 06ECONOMICS-CURRENCY-1985
page.content: There are lots of different kinds of money today.For example there are silver metal 5pence,10pence,20pence and50pence coins and a gold coloured onepound coin.There are also one pound five pound and twenty pound notes.There are 100pence in a pound.Here are some examples of how much things cost in 1985.My bike cost about 60pounds,sugar costs fifty and sixty pence for 2 kilogrammes.A loaf of bread costs 53pence,a packet of tea(125gm) costs 49p.A packet of butter(250gms) costs 50p.Potatoes cost about 35p for 2kg.A pint of milk costs 23p. Records and tapes cost around 6pounds each.Cars cost about 5,000pounds each and a semi-detached house about 25,000pounds. Michelle Millar.
